title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: For some value $$h$$, $$f(x-h)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by $$h$$ units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+h\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by $$h$$ units.
speech: For some value  h , , f of, parentheses x minus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the right by  h  units. Similarly, , f of, parentheses x plus h,   means that f(x) is translated to the left by  h  units.

units. Similarly,  , f of,  x plus h,
means that f(x) is translated to the left by   h
units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$-4$$, $$f{\left(x+4\right)}$$ means that the graph is translated four units to the left.
speech: Since  h  is  negative 4 , , f of, parentheses x plus 4,   means that the graph is translated four units to the left.
pacedSpeech: Since   h
is   negative 4
,  , f of,  x plus 4,
means that the graph is translated four units to the left.

title: Understanding $$f(x-h)$$
speech: f of, parentheses x plus 4,   means that  f of negative 4 is equal to, 2 ,  f of negative 2 is equal to, 0 , and  f of 0, is equal to 1 .

title: Understanding $$h f{\left(x\right)}$$
text: For some value $$h$$ not equal to $$0$$, $$h f{\left(x\right)}$$ means that f(x) is stretched vertically by $$h$$. Similarly, $$\frac{f{\left(x\right)}}{h}$$ means that f(x) is compressed vertically by $$h$$.
speech: For some value  h  not equal to  0 ,  h f of x,  means that f(x) is stretched vertically by  h . Similarly, , fraction, f of x, over h,   means that f(x) is compressed vertically by  h .

. Similarly,  , fraction, f of x, over h,
means that f(x) is compressed vertically by   h

title: Understanding $$h f{\left(x\right)}$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$2$$, $$2f{\left(x\right)}$$ means that the graph is stretched vertically by $$2$$.
speech: Since  h  is  2 ,  2 f of x,  means that the graph is stretched vertically by  2 .

is   2
,   2 f of x,
means that the graph is stretched vertically by   2
